availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dudley C. Dunn (Caldwell/ Lyon co., KY, teamster and wagoner )

body.p: Caldwell County and Lyon County, Kentucky, teamster and wagoner. Kentucky native. Married to Virginia B. Freeman Dunn. Father of Mary A. Dunn, James M. Dunn, Eliza J. Dunn, America B. Dunn, Sarah V. Dunn, T. C. Dunn, and F. D. Dunn. Teamster in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Wagoner in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 379A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 802.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 706.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, District 1, p. 18A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #20040.
